The current top movie is The Battle at Lake Changjin with 5.775 billion. Maoyan predicts Nezha 2's final box office will be 6.74 billion today.
I watched it in the cinema. There are a few low-level jokes, the combat power is unclear, everyone is evenly matched, but the special effects are amazing. It is suitable for families with children, but not very suitable for single people.

Is that guy above having another episode? The topic is about challenging the box office history, and it's also discussing a popcorn movie. You come in and say this kind of movie is not good, what do you like to watch, then why do you even comment? Do you have to show that most people don't have aesthetic taste, and only you do? There are always people like this when browsing V2EX. Also, regarding challenging the box office history, foreigners are much better at it than us. Titanic, Avatar, and the Avengers 4 were all re-released.
Most of the movies on the list are bad.
@wsseo #2 I suggest deleting the last half of your sentence, it's a direct spoiler...

It's good. Box office revenue is supported by visual spectacles and industrial blockbusters. Previously, domestic films relied on drama and comedy films to achieve a few small wins, resulting in all films being of this type. However, there isn't much difference between watching these films in the cinema and on TV, so there is no need to spend several times the cost to see them. This is also an important reason for the overall dismal domestic box office last year. If Nezha can achieve high box office during the Spring Festival, even Detective Chinatown or Creation of the Gods would be good. This way, the producers and investors can understand this problem and make films that are suitable for viewing on the big screen, instead of trying to educate the audience.

As a popcorn movie, Nezha 2 is still very good, and the special effects are top-notch. The plot is just average, but what plot does a popcorn movie need? Marvel and Disney ones don't have much plot either.
